text:
Dear all, quick (but huge) question: “*is light-sheet just for pretty images*?”
Is a provocative question, but I m considering and re-considering the impact of light-sheet in current biological projects (especially because is not uncommon to see L-sheet microscopes purchased and then poorly used); so, the real question is:
_Can you please suggest a few papers (not from L-sheet developers), where you think that using Light-sheet had a critical role for obtaining the results and also had a big impact in biology?_
I mean, papers where, without L-sheet, those results could not have been obtained; and where the results made a big step in biological theories.
I`m investigating this topic in my institute, reviewing the current literature and I`ll be happy to follow up the discussion with whoever wants. Have good imaging & weekend..

text:
Hi Alessandro, very interesting question !!!
Here we have some examples ( e.g. <https://www.nature.com/articles/s41593-018-0093-5>) and few other papers from Courtine lab in which LS microscopy could identify some nuclei in the brain, involved in functional recovery. The unbiased aspect of it was key in this case. In fact I am not aware of too many papers showing this value of LS. I am happy to read other peoples's experience ..
